Study Title: Efficacy and Safety of Romidepsin CHOP vs CHOP in Patients With Untreated Peripheral T-Cell Lymphoma
Brief Summary: Primary objective of the study is to compare the efficacy of romidepsin when administered with CHOP versus CHOP alone in subjects with previously untreated peripheral T-cell lymphoma (PTCL) in terms of progression-free survival (PFS) assessed according to Response criteria for malignant lymphoma 1999 by a Response Adjudication Committee (RAC).
Primary Outcome Measures: The primary efficacy endpoint is Progression Free Survival, The primary efficacy endpoint is Progression Free Survival (PFS) using the response criteria for malignant lymphoma (1999) by a Response Adjudication Committee, 60 months
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
